ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Faceted_brep_shape_representation is a type of shape representation in which the representation items are specializations of faceted brep entities. These differ from the more general B-rep in having only planar faces and implicit edge geometry.

The items attribute of the representation shall contain
Faceted_models or
template_instances .
At least one item in the items set shall be a faceted brep entity, or a mapped item, (See also IP6).

For each faceted brep in the items set: the faces shall be face surfaces, the associated surface for each face shall be a plane, and each plane shall use a cartesian point for its location.
The call to function msb shells in IP2 and IP3 is correct since, although the generic type of the argument `fbrep' is representation item, `fbrep' has been selected by QUERY to be a subtype of manifold solid brep.
An explicit outer bound shall be specified for each face of the faceted brep.
For each manifold solid brep in the items set the outer shell attribute shall not be of the oriented subtype.
If the manifold solid brep is also a brep with voids then each shell in the voids set shall be an oriented closed shell with orientation value FALSE.

If a mapped item is included in the items set then the mapped representation of the mapping source attribute shall be a faceted brep shape representation.
If a cartesian transformation operator 3d is included as mapped item.mapping target with an axis2 placement 3d that corresponds to the original co-ordinate system as mapped representation.mapping origin, then the resulting mapped item is a transformed copy of the faceted brep shape representation. The precise definition of the transformation, including translation, rotation, scaling and, if appropriate, mirroring, is given by the transformation operator.
